examples.text: Five, four, three, two, one, zero… We have lift-off.

definitions.definition: a temperature, pressure, etc. that is equal to zero on a scale

examples.text: It was ten degrees below zero last night *(= −10°C)*.
The thermometer had fallen to zero.

definitions.definition: the lowest possible amount or level; nothing at all

examples.text: I rated my chances as zero.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French zéro or Italian zero, via Old Spanish from Arabic ṣifr ‘cipher’.
